card.name: Aesthir Glider
card.ability:
Flying
Aesthir Glider can't block.
card.flavor:
"A fine example of the rewards of artifice: a thoroughly obedient steed with wings of Soldevi steel."
—Arcum Dagsson,
Soldevi Machinist

card.name: Agent of Stromgald
card.ability: {R}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"The ‘fabled' Order of Stromgald is cast to the four winds, lost for all time. I, for one, give them no thought."
—General Varchild

card.name: Arcane Denial
card.ability:
Counter target spell. Its controller may draw up to two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
You draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.ruling: 9/16/2007 : The controller of the countered spell doesn't choose how many cards to draw until the relevant ability resolves. The player may draw 0, 1, or 2 cards. He or she chooses the number before drawing any cards.

card.name: Ashnod's Cylix
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target player looks at the top three cards of his or her library, puts one of them back on top of his or her library, then exiles the rest.
card.flavor: Few remember that Ashnod's defilement of Terisiare's resources outstripped even that of her peers.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the player has less than 3 cards in his or her library, look at as many as he or she has, put one back, and exile the others.

card.name: Astrolabe
card.ability: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Astrolabe: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

card.name: Awesome Presence
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked unless defending player pays {3} for each creature he or she controls that's blocking it.
card.flavor:
"I shape my weapons from the fears of my enemies."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn
card.ruling: 2/1/2007 : In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.

card.name: Balduvian Dead
card.ability: {2}{R}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put a 3/1 black and red Graveborn creature token with haste onto the battlefield. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : If the ability is activated during a turn's Ending phase (after any "at the beginning of the End step" triggers would have triggered that turn), the Graveborn token will remain on the battlefield until the following turn's End step.

card.name: Balduvian Horde
card.ability: When Balduvian Horde enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.
card.flavor:
"Peace will come only when we have taken Varchild's head."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose whether to discard or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice this card. You can choose to not discard even if you no longer control this card on resolution.

card.name: Balduvian Trading Post
card.ability:
If Balduvian Trading Post would enter the battlefield, sacrifice an untapped Mountain instead. If you do, put Balduvian Trading Post onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {1}{R} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Balduvian Trading Post deals 1 damage to target attacking creature.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You sacrifice the Mountain before this card is put onto the battlefield, and do so no matter how it is put onto the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : This card produces two different types of mana. If an effect that adds one mana to your mana pool of the same type as the mana produced by this card, you choose which of the two types it produces.

card.name: Balduvian War-Makers
card.ability:
Haste
Rampage 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
card.flavor: "We send our best to battle, but every man, woman, and child will stand against Varchild's butchers."Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

card.name: Benthic Explorers
card.ability: {T}, Untap a tapped land an opponent controls: Add one mana of any type that land could produce to your mana pool.
card.flavor: The rising oceans brought new lakes—and new terrors—to Terisiare. The Explorers found their ancient enemies spawning everywhere.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This ability is not targeted any more.
10/1/2009 : Untapping a tapped land an opponent controls is part of the cost of Benthic Explorers's ability. If no opponent controls a tapped land, the ability can't be activated.
10/1/2009 : The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.
10/1/2009 : Benthic Explorers checks the effects of all mana-producing abilities of the land untapped to pay its cost, but it doesn't check the costs of those abilities. For example, Vivid Crag has the ability "{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool." If you untap a tapped Vivid Crag an opponent controls while paying for Benthic Explorers's ability, you can add one mana of any color to your mana pool. It doesn't matter whether that Vivid Crag has a charge counter on it.
10/1/2009 : When determining what types of mana an opponent's land could produce, take into account any applicable replacement effects that would apply to that land's mana abilities (such as Contamination's effect, for example). If there is more than one, consider them in any possible order.
10/1/2009 : Benthic Explorers doesn't care about any restrictions or riders an opponent's land (such as Ancient Ziggurat or Hall of the Bandit Lord) puts on the mana it produces. It just cares about types of mana.

card.name: Bestial Fury
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When Bestial Fury enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, it gets +4/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.

card.name: Bounty of the Hunt
card.ability:
You may exile a green card from your hand rather than pay Bounty of the Hunt's mana cost.
Distribute three +1/+1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures. For each +1/+1 counter you put on a creature this way, remove a +1/+1 counter from that creature at the beginning of the next cleanup step.

card.name: Browse
card.ability: {2}{U}{U}: Look at the top five cards of your library, put one of them into your hand, and exile the rest.
card.flavor:
"Once great literature—now great litter."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

card.name: Burnout
card.ability:
Counter target instant spell if it's blue.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor:
"GOTCHA"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : You may target any instant spell with Burnout. If it's blue at the time Burnout resolves, that spell will be countered and you'll draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep. If it's not blue at the time Burnout resolves, that spell won't be countered, but you'll still draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

card.name: Carrier Pigeons
card.ability:
Flying
When Carrier Pigeons enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor:
"Birds know no borders Why, then, should we?"
—General Varchild, in a missive to King Darien of Kjeldor

card.name: Casting of Bones
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, draw three cards, then discard one of them.
card.flavor:
"Whether whole or not, still we serve Lim-Dûl's wishes."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

card.name: Chaos Harlequin
card.ability: {R}: Exile the top card of your library. If that card is a land card, Chaos Harlequin gets -4/-0 until end of turn. Otherwise, Chaos Harlequin gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Contagion
card.ability:
You may pay 1 life and exile a black card from your hand rather than pay Contagion's mana cost.
Distribute two -2/-1 counters among one or two target creatures.

card.name: Deadly Insect
card.ability: Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor:
"There is no time for pain when this beast leaves its terrible sting."
—Jaeuhl Carthalion,
Juniper Order Advocate

card.name: Death Spark
card.ability:
Death Spark deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Death Spark is in your graveyard with a creature card directly above it, you may pay {1}. If you do, return Death Spark to your hand.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : A card is "directly above" another card in your graveyard if it was put into that graveyard later and there are no cards in between the two.
10/1/2008 : layers may not rearrange the cards in their graveyards.
10/1/2008 : If an effect or rule puts two or more cards into the same graveyard at the same time, the owner of those cards may arrange them in any order.
10/1/2008 : The last thing that happens to a resolving instant or sorcery spell is that it's put into its owner's graveyard. Example: You cast Wrath of God. All creatures on the battlefield are destroyed. You arrange all the cards put into your graveyard this way in any order you want. The other players in the game do the same to the cards that are put into their graveyards. Then you put Wrath of God into your graveyard, on top of the other cards.
10/1/2008 : Say you're the owner of both a permanent and an Aura that's attached to it. If both the permanent and the Aura are destroyed at the same time (by Akroma's Vengeance, for example), you decide the order they're put into your graveyard. If just the enchanted permanent is destroyed, it's put into your graveyard first. Then, after state-based actions are checked, the Aura (which is no longer attached to anything) is put into your graveyard on top of it.

card.name: Diminishing Returns
card.ability: Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library. You exile the top ten cards of your library. Then each player draws up to seven cards.
card.ruling:
9/16/2007 : Each player may choose to draw any number of cards from zero to seven.
9/16/2007 : First the player whose turn it is chooses how many cards to draw, then each other player in turn order chooses. Then the cards are drawn, first by the player whose turn it is, then by each other player in turn order.

card.name: Diseased Vermin
card.ability:
Whenever Diseased Vermin deals combat damage to a player, put an infection counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, Diseased Vermin deals X damage to target opponent previously dealt damage by it, where X is the number of infection counters on it.

card.name: Dystopia
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep—Pay 1 life. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a green or white permanent.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The permanent is chosen and sacrificed during resolution.

card.name: Elvish Bard
card.ability: All creatures able to block Elvish Bard do so.

card.name: Elvish Ranger
card.flavor:
"No one may fault an Elvish Ranger's heart, but the simplest frailty may fell even the proudest warrior."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

card.name: Elvish Spirit Guide
card.ability: Exile Elvish Spirit Guide from your hand: Add {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"We are never without guidance, if we but seek it."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter
card.ruling: 2/1/2007 : This ability is a mana ability.

card.name: Energy Arc
card.ability: Untap any number of target creatures. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by those creatures this turn.
card.flavor:
"Relent, and you may transcend your situation."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen
card.ruling:
9/16/2007 : Energy Arc can target untapped creatures. The second part of the effect will still affect them.
9/16/2007 : The number of target creatures may be zero.

card.name: Enslaved Scout
card.ability: {2}: Enslaved Scout gains mountainwalk until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Even the basest creatures may serve a purpose. Still, their lives need be only as long as the paths we tread."
—General Varchild

card.name: Errand of Duty
card.ability: Put a 1/1 white Knight creature token with banding onto the battlefield. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor:
"Call every able sword to our side. Kjeldor will stand triumphant"
—King Darien of Kjeldor
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Exile
card.ability: Exile target nonwhite attacking creature. You gain life equal to its toughness.

card.name: False Demise
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.
card.flavor:
"Far too many of our missing ‘dead' seem to be turning up in Varchild's ranks"
—King Darien of Kjeldor

card.name: Fatal Lore
card.ability: An opponent chooses one — You draw three cards; or you destroy up to two target creatures that opponent controls and that player draws up to three cards. Those creatures can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"All knowledge has its price."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The opponent chooses which option they want (this is a mode choice). If they choose the "destroy" option, you choose the zero, one, or two targets after that.

card.name: Feast or Famine
card.ability: Choose one — Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield; or destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature and it can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"We are not yet free of Lim-Dûl's terrors."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

card.name: Fevered Strength
card.ability:
Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor:
"The fever clouds the mind as it energizes the body. Both will pass in time."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

card.name: Floodwater Dam
card.ability: {X}{X}{1}, {T}: Tap X target lands.
card.flavor: Viscerid dams may be of living creatures as well as bones and mud.

card.name: Force of Will
card.ability:
You may pay 1 life and exile a blue card from your hand rather than pay Force of Will's mana cost.
Counter target spell.

card.name: Foresight
card.ability:
Search your library for three cards, exile them, then shuffle your library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

card.name: Fyndhorn Druid
card.ability: When Fyndhorn Druid dies, if it was blocked this turn, you gain 4 life.
card.flavor:
"All struggles ultimately require sacrifice. It's just that some sacrifices are dearer than others."
—Jaeuhl Carthalion,
Juniper Order Advocate

card.name: Gargantuan Gorilla
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice a Forest. If you sacrifice a snow Forest this way, Gargantuan Gorilla gains trample until end of turn. If you don't sacrifice a Forest, sacrifice Gargantuan Gorilla and it deals 7 damage to you.
{T}: Gargantuan Gorilla deals damage equal to its power to another target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Gargantuan Gorilla.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Giving either creature first strike does not affect the ability.
10/4/2004 : If this leaves the battlefield before its activated ability resolves, it will still deal damage to the targeted creature. On the other hand, if the targeted creature leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the ability will be countered and no damage will be dealt.

card.name: Gift of the Woods
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn and you gain 1 life.

card.name: Gorilla Berserkers
card.ability:
Trample; rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
Gorilla Berserkers can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.
card.flavor:
"Beneath serenity may lie
a hidden rage."
—Jaeuhl Carthalion,
Juniper Order Advocate

card.name: Gorilla Chieftain
card.ability: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.
card.flavor:
"Oh, no—not you again?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

card.name: Gorilla Shaman
card.ability: {X}{X}{1}: Destroy target noncreature artifact with converted mana cost X.
card.flavor:
"Each generation teaches the next that artifice is the enemy of natural order."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : A tip on how this math works:The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with converted mana cost 0 is {0} + {0} + {1} = {1}.The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with converted mana cost 1 is {1} + {1} + {1} = {3}.The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with converted mana cost 2 is {2} + {2} + {1} = {5}.And so on.

card.name: Gorilla War Cry
card.ability:
Cast Gorilla War Cry only during combat before blockers are declared.
Creatures can't be blocked this turn except by two or more creatures.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor: "Theirs is the art of blood."Jaeuhl Carthalion, Juniper Order Advocate

card.name: Guerrilla Tactics
card.ability:
Guerrilla Tactics deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Guerrilla Tactics, Guerrilla Tactics deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If it is discarded, the damage done by it is done by this card due to an ability and not by a spell.
10/4/2004 : The second ability will trigger even on an optional discard caused by an opponent.
10/4/2004 : Discarding as a cost to cast a spell will not trigger the ability. Only discarding as an effect will trigger the ability.

card.name: Gustha's Scepter
card.ability:
{T}: Exile a card from your hand face down. You may look at it for as long as it remains exiled.
{T}: Return a card you own exiled with Gustha's Scepter to your hand.
When you lose control of Gustha's Scepter, put all cards exiled with Gustha's Scepter into their owner's graveyard.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The last ability will trigger when a different player gains control of Gustha's Scepter, as well as when Gustha's Scepter leaves the battlefield.

card.name: Hail Storm
card.ability: Hail Storm deals 2 damage to each attacking creature and 1 damage to you and each creature you control.
card.flavor:
"If they can't take the hail, they'd better stay home."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

card.name: Heart of Yavimaya
card.ability:
If Heart of Yavimaya would enter the battlefield, sacrifice a Forest instead. If you do, put Heart of Yavimaya onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You have to sacrifice a forest before this card is put onto the battlefield, and no matter how it is put onto the battlefield.

card.name: Helm of Obedience
card.ability: {X}, {T}: Target opponent puts cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard until a creature card or X cards are put into that graveyard this way, whichever comes first. If a creature card is put into that graveyard this way, sacrifice Helm of Obedience and put that card onto the battlefield under your control. X can't be 0.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : You put the creature card onto the battlefield even if you can't sacrifice Helm of Obedience (because it's left the battlefield by the time its ability resolves, for example).
10/1/2008 : If an effect like that of Leyline of the Void prevents cards from being put into your opponent's graveyard, the process described in the first sentence of Helm of Obedience's effect will never stop. Your opponent's entire library will be exiled, even if X is 1.

card.name: Inheritance
card.ability: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {3}. If you do, draw a card.
card.flavor:
"More than lessons may be gained from the past."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : If Inheritance and a creature are each put into a graveyard from the battlefield at the same time, Inheritance's ability will trigger.

card.name: Insidious Bookworms
card.ability: When Insidious Bookworms dies, you may pay {1}{B}. If you do, target player discards a card at random.

card.name: Ivory Gargoyle
card.ability:
Flying
When Ivory Gargoyle dies, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step and you skip your next draw step.
{4}{W}: Exile Ivory Gargoyle.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : The player who controlled Ivory Gargoyle when it was put into a graveyard will skip his or her next draw step even if Ivory Gargoyle is returned to the battlefield under a different player's control (because it's owned by someone else) or isn't returned to the battlefield at all (because it left the graveyard before the end of the turn, for example).
10/1/2008 : The second ability can be activated only if Ivory Gargoyle is on the battlefield.

card.name: Juniper Order Advocate
card.ability: As long as Juniper Order Advocate is untapped, green creatures you control get +1/+1.
card.flavor:
"In these troubled times, we alone carry the hope of reconciliation between Elf and Human."
—Jaeuhl Carthalion,
Juniper Order Advocate
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : If Juniper Order Advocate somehow becomes green, its ability will affect itself.

card.name: Kaysa
card.ability: Green creatures you control get +1/+1.
card.flavor: Kaysa speaks as the Elder Druid, but Yavimaya recognizes only one voice: its own.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Kaysa's ability affects itself.

card.name: Keeper of Tresserhorn
card.ability: Whenever Keeper of Tresserhorn attacks and isn't blocked, it assigns no combat damage this turn and defending player loses 2 life.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability triggers on declaration of blockers if the criteria is met.
4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Kjeldoran Escort
card.ability: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor:
"We willingly trade with Kjeldor, but the peace we build must come from both our lands."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Kjeldoran Home Guard
card.ability: At end of combat, if Kjeldoran Home Guard attacked or blocked this combat, put a -0/-1 counter on Kjeldoran Home Guard and put a 0/1 white Deserter creature token onto the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : The ability will trigger only if Kjeldoran Home Guard is still on the battlefield at end of combat. If it's been dealt lethal combat damage and destroyed during that combat (or has left the battlefield during that combat by any other means), its ability won't trigger and you won't get a token.
10/1/2008 : You put the Deserter token onto the battlefield even if you can't put a -0/-1 counter on Kjeldoran Home Guard (because it left the battlefield after its ability triggered but before it resolved, for example).

card.name: Kjeldoran Outpost
card.ability:
If Kjeldoran Outpost would enter the battlefield, sacrifice a Plains instead. If you do, put Kjeldoran Outpost onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{1}{W}, {T}: Put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You have to sacrifice a plains before this card is put onto the battlefield. You have to do this no matter how it is put onto the battlefield.

card.name: Kjeldoran Pride
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
{2}{U}: Attach Kjeldoran Pride to target creature other than enchanted creature.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The activated ability moves this card to a new permanent.

card.name: Krovikan Horror
card.ability:
At the beginning of the end step, if Krovikan Horror is in your graveyard with a creature card directly above it, you may return Krovikan Horror to your hand.
{1}, Sacrifice a creature: Krovikan Horror deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Krovikan Plague
card.ability:
Enchant non-Wall creature you control
When Krovikan Plague enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Tap enchanted creature: Krovikan Plague deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Put a -0/-1 counter on enchanted creature. Activate this ability only if enchanted creature is untapped.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The Aura will be put into the graveyard if you lose control of the creature or if it somehow becomes a Wall.

card.name: Lake of the Dead
card.ability:
If Lake of the Dead would enter the battlefield, sacrifice a Swamp instead. If you do, put Lake of the Dead onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Add {B}{B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The tap and sacrifice counts as tapping the land for mana.
10/4/2004 : You have to sacrifice a swamp before this card is put onto the battlefield. And you have to do this no matter how it is put onto the battlefield.

card.name: Lat-Nam's Legacy
card.ability: Shuffle a card from your hand into your library. If you do, draw two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor: "All the knowledge of Lat-Nam could not protect its sages from the Brothers' War."Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Shuffling a card from your hand into your library is mandatory. The effect says "if you do" because performing that action might have been impossible. If you fail to shuffle a card into your library because your hand was empty, you won't draw any cards.

card.name: Library of Lat-Nam
card.ability: An opponent chooses one — You draw three cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep; or you search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Lim-Dûl's High Guard
card.ability:
First strike
{1}{B}: Regenerate Lim-Dûl's High Guard.
card.flavor: "The Guard will forever stand ready. For them, death is merely an inconvenience, not an ending."Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

card.name: Lim-Dûl's Paladin
card.ability:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may discard a card. If you don't, sacrifice Lim-Dûl's Paladin and draw a card.
Whenever Lim-Dûl's Paladin becomes blocked, it gets +6/+3 until end of turn.
Whenever Lim-Dûl's Paladin attacks and isn't blocked, it assigns no combat damage to defending player this turn and that player loses 4 life.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Lim-Dûl's Vault
card.ability: Look at the top five cards of your library. As many times as you choose, you may pay 1 life, put those cards on the bottom of your library in any order, then look at the top five cards of your library. Then shuffle your library and put the last cards you looked at this way on top of it in any order.
card.ruling:
9/16/2007 : In other words: -- Step 1: Look at the top five cards of your library. -- Step 2: If you like them, proceed to step 3a. If you don't like them, proceed to step 3b. -- Step 3a: Shuffle the rest of your library, then put those five cards back on top of your library in the order you want. The spell has finished resolving. -- Step 3b: Put those five cards on the bottom of your library in the order you want. Pay 1 life. Return to step 1.
9/16/2007 : If you pay no life, you shuffle the rest of your library and then put the top five cards back on top in any order.
9/16/2007 : If you have five or fewer cards in your library, you can pay 1 life as many times as you like, but you'll keep seeing the same cards

card.name: Lodestone Bauble
card.ability: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Lodestone Bauble: Put up to four target basic land cards from a player's graveyard on top of his or her library in any order. That player draws a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : "Up to four" means zero, one, two, three, or four. If you choose zero targets, you still choose a player. That player will draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

card.name: Lord of Tresserhorn
card.ability:
When Lord of Tresserhorn enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life, you sacrifice two creatures, and target opponent draws two cards.
{B}: Regenerate Lord of Tresserhorn.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : When Lord of Tresserhorn enters the battlefield, if you have zero or one other creature on the battlefield, Lord of Tresserhorn itself will be sacrificed as part of its ability's effect. Regeneration won't save it. The rest of the effect still happens.
10/4/2004 : Since this is a loss of life and not a payment, your life total can be reduced below zero by this.

card.name: Martyrdom
card.ability: Until end of turn, target creature you control gains "{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn is dealt to this creature instead." Only you may activate this ability.
card.flavor:
"The only true immortality is in dying for a cause."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the target stops being a creature, you can't redirect damage to it until/unless it becomes a creature again.
10/4/2004 : If the target creature is not still on the battlefield when the damage is to be redirected, the damage stays where it is.
10/4/2004 : Can be used to redirect damage from that creature to itself. This has no particularly useful effect.

card.name: Misfortune
card.ability: An opponent chooses one — You put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control and gain 4 life; or you put a -1/-1 counter on each creature that player controls and Misfortune deals 4 damage to him or her.

card.name: Mishra's Groundbreaker
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Mishra's Groundbreaker: Target land becomes a 3/3 artifact creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor: The very ground yielded to Mishra's wishes.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.
10/1/2008 : The ability's effect has no duration. The affected land will remain an artifact, creature, and land until the game ends, it leaves the battlefield, or some other effect changes its types.

card.name: Misinformation
card.ability: Put up to three target cards from an opponent's graveyard on top of his or her library in any order.
card.flavor: "When you cannot rely on your sources, trust your own senses. When you cannot trust those, you must follow your instincts."Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : You target the cards, but not the opponent.
10/1/2008 : You don't need to show the opponent what order you put the cards on top of his or her library.

card.name: Mystic Compass
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"And I say north is where I want it to be"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

card.name: Nature's Blessing
card.ability: {G}{W}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature or that creature gains banding, first strike, or trample. (This effect lasts indefinitely. Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor:
"Be open to the blessings, whatever their form."
Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : This ability has no duration. The affected creature will have banding, first strike, or trample until the game ends, it leaves the battlefield, or some other effect causes it to lose its abilities.

card.name: Nature's Chosen
card.ability:
Enchant creature you control
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.
Tap enchanted creature: Untap target artifact, creature, or land. Activate this ability only if enchanted creature is white and is untapped and only once each turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It is put into the graveyard if you lose control of the creature.

card.name: Nature's Wrath
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Nature's Wrath unless you pay {G}.
Whenever a player puts an Island or blue permanent onto the battlefield, he or she sacrifices an Island or blue permanent.
Whenever a player puts a Swamp or black permanent onto the battlefield, he or she sacrifices a Swamp or black permanent.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : A single permanent may cause both the second and third abilities to trigger. For example, Underground Sea is both an Island and a Swamp, and Skeleton Ship is both blue and black.
10/1/2008 : Nature's Wrath cares about who puts the permanent onto the battlefield, not under whose control the permanent enters the battlefield under.

card.name: Noble Steeds
card.ability: {1}{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Only an animal born in the wild has sufficient heart to be a true Knight's steed."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

card.name: Omen of Fire
card.ability:
Return all Islands to their owners' hands.
Each player sacrifices a Plains or a white permanent for each white permanent he or she controls.
card.flavor:
"Let Balduvia burn to warm Kjeldor's hearth"
—General Varchild

card.name: Phantasmal Fiend
card.ability:
{B}: Phantasmal Fiend gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{1}{U}: Switch Phantasmal Fiend's power and toughness until end of turn.
card.ruling:
11/1/2005 : Note that the wording "Effects that alter the creature's power alter its toughness instead, and vice versa, this turn" has been removed.
10/1/2008 : Effects that switch power and toughness are always applied last when determining a creature's power and toughness, even if other power/toughness-changing effects are created later in the turn. For example, if you activate Phantasmal Fiend's first ability, it will become 2/4. Then if you activate its second ability, it will become 4/2. Then if you activate its first ability again, it will become 3/3.
4/15/2013 : Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
4/15/2013 : Switching a creature’s power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

card.name: Phantasmal Sphere
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Phantasmal Sphere, then sacrifice Phantasmal Sphere unless you pay {1} for each +1/+1 counter on it.
When Phantasmal Sphere leaves the battlefield, put a blue Orb creature token with flying onto the battlefield under target opponent's control. That creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Phantasmal Sphere.

card.name: Phelddagrif
card.ability:
{G}: Phelddagrif gains trample until end of turn. Target opponent puts a 1/1 green Hippo creature token onto the battlefield.
{W}: Phelddagrif gains flying until end of turn. Target opponent gains 2 life.
{U}: Return Phelddagrif to its owner's hand. Target opponent may draw a card.
card.ruling: 11/1/2005 : All three abilities are now targeted.

card.name: Phyrexian Boon
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 as long as it's black. Otherwise, it gets -1/-2.
card.flavor:
"Phyrexia's touch is painful to all but the blackest of hearts."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

card.name: Phyrexian Devourer
card.ability:
When Phyrexian Devourer's power is 7 or greater, sacrifice it.
Exile the top card of your library: Put X +1/+1 counters on Phyrexian Devourer, where X is the exiled card's converted mana cost.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : Phyrexian Devourer's first ability continually checks its power as a state trigger. Once it triggers, it won't trigger again as long as the ability is on the stack. If the ability is countered and the trigger condition is still true, it will immediately trigger again. If the ability resolves, you'll have to sacrifice Phyrexian Devourer even if its power has been reduced to 6 or less by then.

card.name: Phyrexian Portal
card.ability: {3}: If your library has ten or more cards in it, target opponent looks at the top ten cards of your library and separates them into two face-down piles. Exile one of those piles. Search the other pile for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle the rest of that pile into your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The two piles don't have to have the same number of cards in them. One of the piles may have zero cards.

card.name: Phyrexian War Beast
card.ability: When Phyrexian War Beast leaves the battlefield, sacrifice a land and Phyrexian War Beast deals 1 damage to you.
card.flavor:
"Knowing its origins, how could they have thought they could control it?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

card.name: Pillage
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"Were they to reduce us to ash, we would clog their throats and sting their eyes in payment."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

card.name: Primitive Justice
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Primitive Justice, you may pay {1}{R} and/or {1}{G} any number of times.
Destroy target artifact. For each additional {1}{R} you paid, destroy another target artifact. For each additional {1}{G} you paid, destroy another target artifact, and you gain 1 life.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : can't target the same artifact more than once, even with different parts of the spell.

card.name: Pyrokinesis
card.ability:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay Pyrokinesis's mana cost.
Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.
card.flavor:
"Anybody want some . . . toast?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can't do fractional points of damage.
10/1/2008 : The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most 4. You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

card.name: Reinforcements
card.ability: Put up to three target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
card.flavor:
"Let them send their legions I will show them that my truth is stronger than their swords."
—General Varchild
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You have to show which creature cards you put on top of your library, but not the order you put them there.

card.name: Reprisal
card.ability: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"Kjeldor's borders are secure, and its citizens are prepared to take up arms in defense of their families."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

card.name: Ritual of the Machine
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Ritual of the Machine, sacrifice a creature.
Gain control of target nonartifact, nonblack creature.
card.flavor:
"Rumors persist of dark deeds performed in the depths of Soldev. When will Dagsson heed the danger therein?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Rogue Skycaptain
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wage counter on Rogue Skycaptain. You may pay {2} for each wage counter on it. If you don't, remove all wage counters from Rogue Skycaptain and an opponent gains control of it.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : No choices are made when this ability triggers. After the wage counter is put on Rogue Skycaptain, then you choose whether to pay mana and, if you don't, which opponent gains control of it.
10/1/2008 : If you can't pay the entire payment, none of it is paid.

card.name: Royal Decree
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Whenever a Swamp, Mountain, black permanent, or red permanent becomes tapped, Royal Decree deals 1 damage to that permanent's controller.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Royal Decree's ability will trigger a maximum of once for each permanent that becomes tapped, even if that permanent meets multiple criteria. (For example, Badlands is both a Swamp and a Mountain.)

card.name: Royal Herbalist
card.ability: {2}, Exile the top card of your library: You gain 1 life.
card.flavor:
"Just as an Herbalist heals a wound, so must we heal the rift between Balduvia and Kjeldor."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

card.name: Scarab of the Unseen
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Scarab of the Unseen: Return all Auras attached to target permanent you own to their owners' hands. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

card.name: Scars of the Veteran
card.ability:
You may exile a white card from your hand rather than pay Scars of the Veteran's mana cost.
Prevent the next 7 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, put a +0/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.

card.name: School of the Unseen
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: After the terrible retribution visited upon Lat-Nam, this school of mages chose to hide from the eyes of the world.

card.name: Seasoned Tactician
card.ability: {3}, Exile the top four cards of your library: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.flavor:
"The benefits of peace far outweigh the pride of Generals."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

card.name: Sheltered Valley
card.ability:
If Sheltered Valley would enter the battlefield, instead sacrifice each other permanent named Sheltered Valley you control, then put Sheltered Valley onto the battlefield.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control three or fewer lands, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

card.name: Shield Sphere
card.ability:
Defender
Whenever Shield Sphere blocks, put a -0/-1 counter on it.
card.flavor:
"My Soldiers know that they need never fear for their protection."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

card.name: Sol Grail
card.ability:
As Sol Grail enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "Look deep into the Grail, and see there what you desire most."Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

card.name: Soldevi Adnate
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice a black or artifact creature: Add to your mana pool an amount of {B} equal to the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost.
card.flavor:
"An idiot cannot hear sense, even when a thousand people speak it."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

card.name: Soldevi Digger
card.ability: {2}: Put the top card of your graveyard on the bottom of your library.
card.flavor:
"This ceaseless device has helped uncover marvels unreachable by mere flesh."
—Arcum Dagsson,
Soldevi Machinist

card.name: Soldevi Excavations
card.ability:
If Soldevi Excavations would enter the battlefield, sacrifice an untapped Island instead. If you do, put Soldevi Excavations onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {1}{U} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This card produces two different types of mana. If an effect that adds one mana to your mana pool of the same type as the mana produced by this card, you choose which of the two types it produces.

card.name: Soldevi Heretic
card.ability: {W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. Target opponent may draw a card.
card.flavor:
"In the arms of tragedy, there is little comfort in being right."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

card.name: Soldevi Sage
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice two lands: Draw three cards, then discard one of them.
card.flavor:
"To hide the truth is more than folly—it is fatal."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

card.name: Soldevi Sentry
card.ability: {1}: Choose target opponent. Regenerate Soldevi Sentry. When it regenerates this way, that player may draw a card.
card.flavor:
"A dreadful invention. What ease is there under the watchful eye of cold steel?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

card.name: Soldevi Steam Beast
card.ability:
Whenever Soldevi Steam Beast becomes tapped, target opponent gains 2 life.
{2}: Regenerate Soldevi Steam Beast.
card.flavor: "Nothing has ever broken my heart so much as this—the betrayal of Soldev by my beloved machines"Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

card.name: Soldier of Fortune
card.ability: {R}, {T}: Target player shuffles his or her library.
card.flavor:
"Loyalty to coin alone is loyalty nonetheless."
—General Varchild

card.name: Spiny Starfish
card.ability:
{U}: Regenerate Spiny Starfish.
At the beginning of each end step, if Spiny Starfish regenerated this turn, put a 0/1 blue Starfish creature token onto the battlefield for each time it regenerated this turn.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The token is put onto the battlefield even if this card is not on the battlefield at the beginning of the end step.
10/1/2009 : Spiny Starfish's first ability creates a regeneration shield for it. Spiny Starfish's second ability checks whether it _used_ any regeneration shields that turn, not whether any regeneration shields were created for it.
10/1/2009 : The second ability doesn't care where the regeneration shields Spiny Starfish used that turn came from. If it regenerated due to a regeneration shield from Refresh, for example, the ability will still put a Starfish token onto the battlefield.
10/1/2009 : The second ability has an "intervening 'if' clause," so it won't trigger at all unless Spiny Starfish had regenerated that turn. However, the number of tokens that are created isn't determined until the ability resolves (in case it regenerates again before that time).
10/1/2009 : If Spiny Starfish regenerates during the end step after its second ability has resolved, no tokens will be created as a result.

card.name: Splintering Wind
card.ability: {2}{G}: Splintering Wind deals 1 damage to target creature. Put a 1/1 green Splinter creature token onto the battlefield. It has flying and "Cumulative upkeep {G}." When it leaves the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to you and each creature you control. (At the beginning of its controller's upkeep, that player puts an age counter on it, then sacrifices it unless he or she pays its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

card.name: Stench of Decay
card.ability: Nonartifact creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Disa is dead, and I am left. I shall allow no others to succumb to this pestilence."
—Kolbjörn, High Honored Druid

card.name: Storm Cauldron
card.ability:
Each player may play an additional land during each of his or her turns.
Whenever a land is tapped for mana, return it to its owner's hand.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a land is tapped for mana and sacrificed all in one action, it goes to the graveyard before the Cauldron can return it to the player's hand.
10/4/2004 : If a land is tapped for mana, it is returned to its owner's hand as a triggered ability.
10/4/2004 : Having multiples of these on the battlefield means you can play an additional land for each one.

card.name: Storm Crow
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor:
"Watch for it Right on its tailfeathers will be a storm from your nightmares."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

card.name: Storm Elemental
card.ability:
Flying
{U}, Exile the top card of your library: Tap target creature with flying.
{U}, Exile the top card of your library: If the exiled card is a snow land, Storm Elemental gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Even though the two activated abilities have the same cost, they're separate. You choose which one you're activating before you exile the top card of your library (and see what it is).
10/1/2008 : If you activate Storm Elemental's third ability and the exiled card is not a snow land, the ability has no effect.

card.name: Storm Shaman
card.ability: {R}: Storm Shaman gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Let the lightning be your warning, and the thunder your battle cry."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

card.name: Stromgald Spy
card.ability: Whenever Stromgald Spy attacks and isn't blocked, you may have defending player play with his or her hand revealed for as long as Stromgald Spy remains on the battlefield. If you do, Stromgald Spy assigns no combat damage this turn.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Suffocation
card.ability:
Cast Suffocation only if you were dealt damage this turn by a red instant or sorcery spell.
Suffocation deals 4 damage to the controller of the last red instant or sorcery spell that dealt damage to you this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It means "red instant or red sorcery" not "red instant or any sorcery".

card.name: Surge of Strength
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Surge of Strength, discard a red or green card.
Target creature gains trample and gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is that creature's converted mana cost.

card.name: Sustaining Spirit
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {1}{W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
card.flavor:
"Faith is our greatest protector."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Does not affect damage if you are already at zero or negative life. You still take it all.
10/1/2008 : Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.
10/1/2008 : The second ability applies only if your life total is being reduced by damage. Other effects or costs (such as "lose 1 life" or "pay 1 life") can reduce your life total below 1 as normal.
10/1/2008 : If an effect asks you to pay life, you can't pay more life than you have.
10/1/2008 : The second ability is not a prevention effect. It stops unpreventable damage from reducing your life total below 1.
10/1/2008 : The ability doesn't change how much damage is dealt; it just changes how much life that damage makes you lose. An effect such as Spirit Link will see the full amount of damage being dealt.
10/1/2008 : Sustaining Spirit won't prevent you from losing the game if your life total is 0 or less or some other effect causes you to lose the game.

card.name: Swamp Mosquito
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Swamp Mosquito attacks and isn't blocked, defending player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Triggers immediately after blocking is declared if at that time no blockers are assigned to it.
4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Sworn Defender
card.ability: {1}: Sworn Defender's power becomes the toughness of target creature blocking or being blocked by Sworn Defender minus 1 until end of turn, and Sworn Defender's toughness becomes 1 plus the power of that creature until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

card.name: Taste of Paradise
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Taste of Paradise, you may pay {1}{G} any number of times.
You gain 3 life plus an additional 3 life for each additional {1}{G} you paid.
card.flavor:
"Any who drink of Freyalise's bounty drink the mead of rebirth."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

card.name: Thawing Glaciers
card.ability:
Thawing Glaciers enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}, {T}: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library. Return Thawing Glaciers to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The land put onto the battlefield does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Thought Lash
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep—Exile the top card of your library. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When a player doesn't pay Thought Lash's cumulative upkeep, that player exiles all cards from his or her library.
Exile the top card of your library: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you don't pay Thought Lash's cumulative upkeep, you'll sacrifice Thought Lash as normal, then, when its triggered ability resolves, you'll exile all cards in your library.
10/1/2008 : If your library has no cards in it, you can't activate the last ability.

card.name: Tidal Control
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Pay 2 life or {2}: Counter target red or green spell. Any player may activate this ability.

card.name: Tornado
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{2}{G}, Pay 3 life for each velocity counter on Tornado: Destroy target permanent and put a velocity counter on Tornado. Activate this ability only once each turn.

card.name: Undergrowth
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Undergrowth, you may pay {2}{R}.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. If its additional cost was paid, Undergrowth doesn't affect combat damage that would be dealt by red creatures.
card.flavor: "The art of war is turning obstacle to advantage."Jaeuhl Carthalion, Juniper Order Advocate
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It means that red creatures still deal damage if you pay the additional cost.

card.name: Unlikely Alliance
card.ability: {1}{W}: Target nonattacking, nonblocking creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Strange alliances are alliances still, and provide the same protection."
—King Darien of Kjeldor
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The bonus is not lost if the creature later becomes an attacker or blocker. The limitation is just there to prevent the effect from being used late in an attack.

card.name: Urza's Engine
card.ability:
Trample
{3}: Urza's Engine gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
{3}: Attacking creatures banded with Urza's Engine gain trample until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Humans and machines working together can be fearsome indeed"Arcum Dagsson
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Varchild's Crusader
card.ability: {0}: Varchild's Crusader can't be blocked this turn except by Walls. Sacrifice Varchild's Crusader at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor: "We could have peace, but Varchild would rather have the maps of the new Kjeldor drawn in Balduvian blood."King Darien of Kjeldor

card.name: Varchild's War-Riders
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep—Put a 1/1 red Survivor creature token onto the battlefield under an opponent's control. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Trample; rampage 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
card.flavor: "What tries to crush our spirit only strengthens our resolve."Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : In a multiplayer game, you can put the Survivor tokens onto the battlefield under the control of different players.
10/1/2008 : Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.

card.name: Veteran's Voice
card.ability:
Enchant creature you control
Tap enchanted creature: Target creature other than the creature tapped this way gets +2/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if enchanted creature is untapped.
card.flavor: "Good soldiers rely first upon their training, then upon their instincts."King Darien of Kjeldor
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Is put into its owner's graveyard if you lose control of the creature.

card.name: Viscerid Armor
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{1}{U}: Return Viscerid Armor to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: A fallen Viscerid's only tribute is to be worn by a comrade.

card.name: Viscerid Drone
card.ability:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature and a Swamp: Destroy target nonartifact creature. It can't be regenerated.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature and a snow Swamp: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: Not all of Terisiare's flooding was natural . . . .

card.name: Wandering Mage
card.ability:
{W}, Pay 1 life: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
{U}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target Cleric or Wizard creature this turn.
{B}, Put a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target player this turn.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : The second ability checks that the targeted creature is a Cleric or Wizard only at the time the ability is activated and at the time it resolves. It doesn't check at the time the damage is actually prevented.
10/1/2009 : If you activate Wandering Mage's third ability, you put the -1/-1 counter on a creature you control as a cost. That means it happens when you activate the ability, not when it resolves. If paying the cost causes the only creature you control to have 0 toughness, it's put into the graveyard before you can pay the cost again.

card.name: Whip Vine
card.ability:
Defender; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
You may choose not to untap Whip Vine during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target creature with flying blocked by Whip Vine. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Whip Vine remains tapped.

card.name: Whirling Catapult
card.ability: {2}, Exile the top two cards of your library: Whirling Catapult deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player.
card.flavor:
"Direct confrontation never was to the Orcs' taste."
—General Varchild
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : If your library has fewer than two cards in it, you can't activate the ability.

card.name: Wild Aesthir
card.ability:
Flying, first strike
{W}{W}: Wild Aesthir gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor:
"High in the Karplusans, death is swift and razor-clawed."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

card.name: Winter's Night
card.ability: Whenever a player taps a snow land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced. That land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a land affected by Winter's Night is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, the "doesn't untap" effect doesn't do anything. It won't apply at some later time when that land is tapped.
10/1/2008 : Winter's Night doesn't track the lands' controllers. If an affected land changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, Winter's Night will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.
10/1/2008 : This has the supertype world. This supertype is similar to legendary. The difference is that when a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

card.name: Yavimaya Ancients
card.ability: {G}: Yavimaya Ancients gets +1/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"We orphans of Fyndhorn have found no welcome in this alien place."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

card.name: Yavimaya Ants
card.ability:
Trample, haste
Cumulative upkeep {G}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
card.flavor:
"Few natural forces are as devastating as hunger."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.

Flying

Counter target spell. Its controller may draw up to two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

Enchant creature

card.ruling: 2/1/2007 : In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.

card.name: Balduvian War-Makers
card.ability:
Haste
Rampage 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
card.flavor:
"Those mewling Barbarians will cower before my righteous steel"

card.name: Benthic Explorers
card.ability: {T}, Untap a tapped land an opponent controls: Add one mana of any type that land could produce to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Distant Atlantis charged these Explorers with the task of venturing into unknown waters to track the despised Viscerids.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This ability is not targeted any more.
10/1/2009 : Untapping a tapped land an opponent controls is part of the cost of Benthic Explorers's ability. If no opponent controls a tapped land, the ability can't be activated.
10/1/2009 : The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.
10/1/2009 : Benthic Explorers checks the effects of all mana-producing abilities of the land untapped to pay its cost, but it doesn't check the costs of those abilities. For example, Vivid Crag has the ability "{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool." If you untap a tapped Vivid Crag an opponent controls while paying for Benthic Explorers's ability, you can add one mana of any color to your mana pool. It doesn't matter whether that Vivid Crag has a charge counter on it.
10/1/2009 : When determining what types of mana an opponent's land could produce, take into account any applicable replacement effects that would apply to that land's mana abilities (such as Contamination's effect, for example). If there is more than one, consider them in any possible order.
10/1/2009 : Benthic Explorers doesn't care about any restrictions or riders an opponent's land (such as Ancient Ziggurat or Hall of the Bandit Lord) puts on the mana it produces. It just cares about types of mana.

card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : A tip on how this math works:The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with converted mana cost 0 is {0} + {0} + {1} = {1}.The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with converted mana cost 1 is {1} + {1} + {1} = {3}.The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with converted mana cost 2 is {2} + {2} + {1} = {5}.And so on.

Guerrilla Tactics deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Guerrilla Tactics, Guerrilla Tactics deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

10/4/2004 : If it is discarded, the damage done by it is done by this card due to an ability and not by a spell.
10/4/2004 : The second ability will trigger even on an optional discard caused by an opponent.
10/4/2004 : Discarding as a cost to cast a spell will not trigger the ability. Only discarding as an effect will trigger the ability.

card.ability: When Insidious Bookworms dies, you may pay {1}{B}. If you do, target player discards a card at random.

card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Kjeldoran Pride
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
{2}{U}: Attach Kjeldoran Pride to target creature other than enchanted creature.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The activated ability moves this card to a new permanent.

card.name: Lat-Nam's Legacy
card.ability: Shuffle a card from your hand into your library. If you do, draw two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.flavor: "Lat-Nam has bequeathed us its secrets. With them we shall attain true enlightenment."Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Shuffling a card from your hand into your library is mandatory. The effect says "if you do" because performing that action might have been impossible. If you fail to shuffle a card into your library because your hand was empty, you won't draw any cards.

card.name: Lim-Dûl's High Guard
card.ability:
First strike
{1}{B}: Regenerate Lim-Dûl's High Guard.
card.flavor:
"Death does not prevent us from service to our absent master. As long as Tresserhorn stands, so shall we."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

card.name: Martyrdom
card.ability: Until end of turn, target creature you control gains "{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn is dealt to this creature instead." Only you may activate this ability.
card.flavor:
"Martyrs are cheaper than mercenaries, and a far better investment."
—General Varchild
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the target stops being a creature, you can't redirect damage to it until/unless it becomes a creature again.
10/4/2004 : If the target creature is not still on the battlefield when the damage is to be redirected, the damage stays where it is.
10/4/2004 : Can be used to redirect damage from that creature to itself. This has no particularly useful effect.

card.name: Noble Steeds
card.ability: {1}{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"They are fighters as fine as any Knight they carry."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

card.name: Phantasmal Fiend
card.ability:
{B}: Phantasmal Fiend gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{1}{U}: Switch Phantasmal Fiend's power and toughness until end of turn.
card.ruling:
11/1/2005 : Note that the wording "Effects that alter the creature's power alter its toughness instead, and vice versa, this turn" has been removed.
10/1/2008 : Effects that switch power and toughness are always applied last when determining a creature's power and toughness, even if other power/toughness-changing effects are created later in the turn. For example, if you activate Phantasmal Fiend's first ability, it will become 2/4. Then if you activate its second ability, it will become 4/2. Then if you activate its first ability again, it will become 3/3.
4/15/2013 : Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
4/15/2013 : Switching a creature’s power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

card.name: Phyrexian Boon
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 as long as it's black. Otherwise, it gets -1/-2.

"Dagsson should have paid attention to the lessons of Phyrexia before attempting to create a mechanical utopia."
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

card.name: Phyrexian War Beast

card.flavor:

Soldevi Machinist

—King Darien of Kjeldor

card.name: Reprisal

—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

card.name: Soldevi Adnate

Soldevi Machinist

Whenever Soldevi Steam Beast becomes tapped, target opponent gains 2 life.
{2}: Regenerate Soldevi Steam Beast.
card.flavor:
"Dagsson saw the steam as life-giving—until his followers felt its scalding touch."

card.name: Storm Crow
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

Balduvian Chieftain

card.name: Swamp Mosquito
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Swamp Mosquito attacks and isn't blocked, defending player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Triggers immediately after blocking is declared if at that time no blockers are assigned to it.
4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Taste of Paradise
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Taste of Paradise, you may pay {1}{G} any number of times.
You gain 3 life plus an additional 3 life for each additional {1}{G} you paid.
card.flavor:
"There is, in each of us, the potential to heal and the gift of renewed life."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

card.name: Undergrowth
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Undergrowth, you may pay {2}{R}.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. If its additional cost was paid, Undergrowth doesn't affect combat damage that would be dealt by red creatures.
card.flavor: "It is the work of sorcery. Burn it"Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It means that red creatures still deal damage if you pay the additional cost.

card.name: Varchild's Crusader
card.ability: {0}: Varchild's Crusader can't be blocked this turn except by Walls. Sacrifice Varchild's Crusader at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor:
"Every patch of land must belong to Kjeldor, no matter what the cost"
—General Varchild

card.name: Veteran's Voice
card.ability:
Enchant creature you control
Tap enchanted creature: Target creature other than the creature tapped this way gets +2/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if enchanted creature is untapped.
card.flavor:
"Teach by example. If your students do not survive, they were not worth the lesson."
—General Varchild
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Is put into its owner's graveyard if you lose control of the creature.

card.name: Viscerid Armor
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{1}{U}: Return Viscerid Armor to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: One Viscerid's death is often another's gain.

card.name: Whip Vine
card.ability:
Defender; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
You may choose not to untap Whip Vine during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target creature with flying blocked by Whip Vine. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Whip Vine remains tapped.

card.name: Wild Aesthir
card.ability:
Flying, first strike
{W}{W}: Wild Aesthir gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor:
"What Barbarian secrets do they spy from their lofty perch?"
—General Varchild

card.name: Yavimaya Ancients
card.ability: {G}: Yavimaya Ancients gets +1/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The Ancients teach us that if we can but last, we shall prevail."
—Kaysa, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order
